item.title: Kingdom Hearts Fans in Europe Should Look Out for June 12
item.description: The Kingdom Hearts All-In-One Package was originally released in 2020. It features all the games within the Dark Seeker Saga. On June 12, a physical version of this title will be released in Europe.

item.title: Persona Fans May Be in For a Huge Treat Real Soon
item.description: Atlus had an amazing year last year with strong releases like Metaphor: ReFantazio and Persona 3: Reload. Now it looks like they are continuing the momentum with more incredible titles. Two upcoming Persona titles may be getting updates soon.

item.title: Animal Jam Codes (April 2025)
item.description:
Animal Jam is a mobile game for children that can entertain them, as well as teach something useful. Each player chooses and customizes an animal, explores the game world, communicates with other players, and participates in mini-games. In addition, in Animal Jam , you can learn more about each animal, see actual photos, and learn some interesting facts about them in the tips during downloads.

Many activities or customization items require in-game currency, and fortunately, you don't have to buy them with real money. Instead, you can redeem Animal Jam codes and get many Gems for free.

Updated April 21, 2025, by Artur Novichenko: If you're looking to stock up on Gems in Animal Jam , there are plenty of active codes you can redeem right now. These rewards can help you grab new items and customize your experience in the game. Be sure to come back for the latest updates as more codes may be added soon.

All Animal Jam Codes

You can find active Animal Jam codes below.

Active Codes

How to Redeem Codes in Animal Jam

Codes in Animal Jam are redeemed similarly to other mobile games. However, you may encounter some difficulties because this is a game for kids and needs to be linked to a parental email. After verification, you can redeem Animal Jam codes. We will explain how in the guide below:

  • Launch Animal Jam and complete the tutorial.
  • Look in the top-right corner of the screen. Tap the gear button to go to the settings.
  • In the lower-left corner of the window, press Redeem Code.
  • Paste the code from the list of active codes into the field and press Continue.

How to Get More Animal Jam Codes

If you want to get the latest active codes for this great game for education, you can bookmark this page, as we update it regularly. Alternatively, you can visit the official developer web resources, where the latest codes are also posted:

  • Animal Jam Community in Discord
  • Animal Jam X page

Animal Jam is available on PC and mobile.

item.title: Best Heavy Bowguns In Monster Hunter Wilds, Ranked
item.description:
Monster Hunter Wilds offers a large variety of weapons and play styles, with 14 base weapon types and a multitude of crafting variations for each. Heavy Bowguns are one of three ranged-only weapon types, alongside the Light Bowgun and the Bow. The Heavy Bowgun is a hard-hitting, slow-firing variant that relies on players being able to take their attack opportunities wisely.

Heavy Bowguns rely a lot on Ignition Mode to fire special ammo, which requires building the Ignition Gauge effectively. Different types of Heavy Bowguns have different effects on how the Ignition gauge will charge. On top of that, different Heavy Bowguns have access to different special ammo types, as well as different ammo mods. That means there's a lot to consider when choosing the right Heavy Bowgun for a player's build.

This topic focuses on the best Heavy Bowguns that are available throughout the campaign, to help with the player's journey to High Rank, as well as the best Heavy Bowguns to take on the endgame. With that in mind, these are the best Heavy Bowguns in Monster Hunter Wilds .

7 Bone Shooter II

Low Rank Bowgun Upgrade

Weapon Stats:

  • Rarity: 2
  • Attack: 195
  • Special Ammo: Wyvernheart Ignition, Wyverncounter Ignition
  • Skills: Guard lv.1, Attack Boost lv.1
  • Crafting Tree: Bone

This low-rank Heavy Bowgun upgrade is one of the best all-around options that players can use early on in Monster Hunter Wilds . The inherent skills Guard and Attack Boost provide fairly minor benefits at this stage, but they're useful to have.

The Bone Shooter also has access to some useful special ammo types, and Spread and Pierce ammo as basic types, which can help players get used to different ammunition and how to get optimal damage with each early on.

6 G. Veldian Tormentum I

Early Game Tetrad Shot Bowgun

Weapon Stats:

  • Rarity: 4
  • Attack: 255
  • Special Ammo: Wyvernpiercer Ignition, Wyvernblast Ignition
  • Skills: Tetrad Shot lv.2
  • Crafting Tree: G. Arkveld

Tetrad Shot is one of the best skills for Heavy Bowgun users, and the G. Veldian Tormentum is an early option with the skill built in. Players will have to get to and defeat Guardian Arkveld before they can craft this weapon, but it's a good option for mid-game thereafter.

Tetrad Shot empowers the fourth and sixth shots from a magazine, and this Bowgun's ammo types have enough capacity to make use of it. This combines well with builds using Burst, as the sixth shot of consecutive hits will get both skills' bonuses and deal big damage.

5 Tankmage I

Mid-Game Heavy Bowgun

Weapon Stats:

  • Rarity: 5
  • Attack: 270
  • Special Ammo: Wyvernheart Ignition, Wyverncounter Ignition, Ignition type ST I
  • Skills: Guard lv.2
  • Crafting Tree: Gypceros

As players move from mid-game to the early part of High Rank hunting in Monster Hunter Wilds , they'll need a Heavy Bowgun that can carry them until better options become available. The Tankmage has versatile uses with Cluster and Spread ammo at level two, and access to Poison and Exhaust as special ammo types.

The inherent skill of Guard level two isn't the most useful weapon skill, but there are enough decoration slots to get three ranks in Tetrad Shot. The upgraded Ignition Mode on this weapon also gets players more use out of their Wyvernheart and Wyverncounter shots.

4 Artian Sheller I

Early High Rank Artian Bowgun

Weapon Stats:

  • Rarity: 6
  • Attack: 255
  • Special Ammo: Wyvernpiercer Ignition, Wyvernblast Ignition, Ignition type ST I
  • Skills: None
  • Crafting Tree : Artian

The customizability of Artian weapons makes them arguably the best choice for many weapon categories once players can access them. The first Artian Heavy Bowgun is the Artian Sheller, and it's a rarity six weapon that can be crafted relatively early in a player's High Rank journey.

Players can build this weapon to suit their preferences, but a good option at this stage is to aim for attack and affinity infusions first, and use paralysis as the element/status. Pierce ammo should be the priority for ammo mods. Aim for capacity as reinforcements to boost the effectiveness of Tetrad Shot, which can be added with decorations.

3 Ableben Abzug

Gore Magala Endgame Bowgun

Weapon Stats:

  • Rarity: 8
  • Attack: 300
  • Special Ammo: Wyvernheart Ignition, Wyverncounter Ignition
  • Skills: Critical Element lv.3
  • Crafting Tree : Gore Magala

Once players get to the highest hunter ranks, they're going to need a rarity eight weapon to take on the rank 36 and above monsters. The final upgrade in the Gore Magala tree, Ableben Abzug, is a good option if players want to go for high raw damage and affinity.

This weapon is great with a build focused on critical hits, and works well with skills like Weakness Exploit, Flayer, and Agitator built into the player's armor. The weapon also comes with level three Pierce ammo, which is one of the stronger basic ammo types.

2 G. Aeternal Palamedes

G. Arkveld Endgame Bowgun

Weapon Stats:

  • Rarity: 8
  • Attack: 360
  • Special Ammo: Wyvernpiercer Ignition, Wyvernblast Ignition
  • Skills: Tetrad Shot lv.2
  • Crafting Tree : G. Arkveld

The G. Aeternal Palamedes has the highest raw damage of any Heavy Bowgun (equal to the Gravios Gigahowl), and comes with Tetrad Shot level two built in. It has low affinity, so this weapon is best used with builds that focus on loading the damage up-front with attack buffs. Combining the attack bonuses from Burst, Agitator, and Tetrad Shot can work well for this.

The weapon comes with two level three decoration slots, so there's plenty of ability to slot in multiple ranks of the player's preferred weapon skills. This Bowgun can be a good raw damage option for the endgame if players don't want to use an Artian weapon.

1 Greifen

Artian Heavy Bowgun

Weapon Stats:

  • Rarity: 8
  • Attack: 285
  • Special Ammo: Wyvernpiercer Ignition, Wyvernblast Ignition, (Ignition type ST I)
  • Skills: None
  • Crafting Tree : Artian

The Greifen is the final upgrade in the Artian weapon tree, and it's one of the most powerful Heavy Bowguns available for Monster Hunter Wilds ' endgame, though some of that is dependent on rolling the desired infusions. As with the Artian Sheller, it's a good idea to go for attack and affinity infusions first and use paralysis as the element/status.

Further reinforcement with attack, affinity, and capacity should be prioritized, and players can choose to use mods for Pierce or Spread ammo, depending on which they prefer at this point in the game. Being an Artian weapon, there's plenty of room for weapon decorations to slot in Tetrad Shot, Ballistics, Opening Shot, or any other weapon skills players prefer.

10 Images
10 Images

item.title: RuneScape: Dragonwilds - Dragon Slayer Quest Guide
item.description:
In RuneScape: Dragonwilds , the lands of Ashenfall are dangerous and filled with dozens of secret quests to complete. But if players follow the main quest line, Dragon Slayer, things might get tricky, and it's easy to get lost since there's no exact quest marker, but a general area where you need to look for each step.

So, to make things easier for players, this guide includes all the hidden information the game doesn't tell them about, including pinpointed locations for quest items, where to go, and key places to visit. Let's start with how to trigger the main quest of RuneScape: Dragonwilds .

How To Start Dragon Slayer In RuneScape: Dragonwilds

To start this quest, players need to travel to Bramblemead Valley and look for a ruined structure similar to a tower. That's where the Wise Old Man is, who will inform the players about the need to slay Velgar (the poisonous giant dragon harassing them from the moment they set foot in the valley). But first, they need to build a shelter.

Crafting a simple structure and some walls might be enough for now, but players should use this spot as a base of operations, since they will need to return often, and once they unlock teleport, it will be easy to move around and return. Plus, the area doesn't have High Tier enemy raids, which are quite annoying. Only goblins come to attack the player, so the first step should be completed around this zone to ease things up.

Next, players will need to get themselves some utilities: Crafting benches, Cooking Pot, and hunt down some deer using a bow. To craft a bow, they need to craft the Spinning Wheel and some Thread. After players get a bow and some arrows, it is time to get the Wise old man some Antlers to cast a tracking spell. Deer are almost everywhere around Bramblemead Valley and Temple Woods, so it won't be so hard to get a couple of Antlers in no time.

Now, return to Wise Old Man to deliver the Antlers . He will tell players that the next step in this quest is to track down Cathan , an adventurer who was part of the expedition and decided to face Velgar alone. To start this part of the quest, travel to the middle area of Bramblemead Valley. Be careful, though, as the area is filled with Goblin Bruisers, Archers, and Warriors.

Ascend to the top of the castle and look for a Lore Object at the top of it: It's a blue glowing book, there's no way to miss it. After reading it, a message will read: "The Air Seems Gloom With Dread. Velgar descends upon the Fortress." The dragon will then land on the Fortress' gate, and players will need to run for their lives.

How To Find The Swamp Vault & Cathan's Trail

After surviving the dragon attack, players will notice the quest Marker points to an area north. They need to return to base, resupply, and prepare for a long expedition through the Whispering Swamp to continue this quest. Now, the quest marker points to a general area of the swamp (the eastern middle section of the map), but the exact place they need to search for is the Dragonkin Vault : a blue glowing door that hides a dungeon left by the ruling race of these lands eons ago.

Travel to the swamp, but mind the goblin archers and Giant Rotten Rats that can land the annoying poison status. Players can also try crafting the Antipoison Potion and the Fortifying Crunchies using the mats available in the Swamp.

Once players have located the Vault, they should enter and prepare for a tough fight. Vault Guardians, Sentinels, and even an Archon lie waiting there for them. Transit across the trap-ridden hallways following the goblin corpses until finding a hidden room on the northeastern side. There's a dying Goblin there , speak to him to follow Cathan's trail.

There's a hidden room on the opposite side of the hallway that hides the Anti-Dragon Shield recipe. Don't forget to pick it up before talking to the Goblin NPC.

How To Find Cathan In RuneScape: Dragonwilds

Apparently, Cathan tricked the goblins, and this ended poorly for them. Now, he is headed for the Fractured Plains , a place known as the Gornfell. Players should return to base once more to resupply, craft Tier 2 equipment, and prepare lots of potions and materials to build a Lodestone to teleport (in case they die and need to go back to pick up their loot).

Fractured Plains is the land just above the Whispering Swamp, and players need to access the swamp through the western section to be able to go across it. Once players arrive at this new area, they should look for a safe spot to place their Lodestone, so they can teleport later. Following the trail of goblins in the path, players will probably face Wolves (which are quite annoying) and meet their first Garou enemies: Bulky, wolf-like humanoids that really pack a punch.

The exact spot where players need to search is the Obelisk in the middle of the Fractured Plains . Travel there with extreme care, and mind the Garou, Terrorbirds, Wolves, and Dire Wolves roaming around.

Cathan is located across the bridge that leads to the Obelisk/Tower, but to access it, players will have to fight a Garou Thane . This monstrous enemy has an enormous shield that prevents damage, and players need to break their guard to cause damage to him.

Once players have defeated him, they can go ahead and speak with Cathan's Ghost , who lies waiting at the foot of the Obelisk, across the bridge.

The best approach to defeat the Garou Thane is to shoot arrows from a safe distance and avoid engaging him in melee, since he can delete players in one single swing of his mighty axe. If players are lucky, it will drop the recipe for Thane's Authority, the most powerful battle axe in the game.

How To Craft Challenge Horn

After speaking to Cathan's Ghost, players will now have their final task before facing Velgar at the top of the Tower in Fractured Plains. But to do that, they need to craft the Challenge Horn, a Quest Item needed to make Velgar face players in direct combat.

But before getting the materials needed to craft the Horn, players should increase their Tier Level to 4. That means they will need the Iron Pickaxe and Iron Logging Axe , and to farm lots of materials starting with Iron Ore from the Stormtouched Highlands.

So, travel there and mine some ore, watching out for the enemies like Garou, Dire Wolves, and the especially dangerous Shocking Plants and Garou Berserkers. After getting enough Iron Ore to craft the Iron Pickaxe and Iron Logging Axe, players should be clear to obtain the two Special Resources they need to craft the Challenge Horn, and face Velgar.

How To Get Bloodwood Sap

To get the Bloodwood Sap, players need to travel to the Bloodblight Swamp area, and remember to carry Antipoison Potions they will need several of them to reach the area where the Bloodwood Tree is growing, which is a structure located in the Southeastern end of the map, inside a fortress protected by Tier 3 Garou enemies: Berserkers, Archers, Druids, and the powerful Thanes.

Once players make it to the top of the fortress and locate the huge gnarling tree that has some protrusions, players need to cut down using the Iron Logging Axe to extract the Bloodwood Sap. Currently, this is the only place where players can extract this element, so make sure to get the most out of it by using the Axtral Projection Spell from Woodcutting.

How To Get Dragon Tooth

Dragon Tooth can be mined using the Iron Pickaxe from a series of bones located in the most dangerous region (currently available) of Ashenfall: The Stormtouched Highlands . Players should prepare lots of potions, food, and a Lodestone Teleporter before proceeding, and also: Make sure to have at least a Tier 4 weapon and basic Tier 4 armor.

Then head to the middle of the Stormtouched Highlands, and follow the dragon bones until finding the spot indicated in the image above. Then, get the Pickaxe and mine the Dragon Tooth from the lower jaw of the dead beast.

How To Get Bronze Bars

Bronze Bars are obtained by smelting Tin Ore and Copper Ore together. Tin Ore and Copper Ore can be mined from the Fractured Plains and are lying around the walls, the mountains, and mostly everywhere.

Players will need 5x Bronze Bars to craft the Challenge Horn, which means 15x Tin Ore and 15x Copper Ore put together in the Smelter. Once players have all the mats, they can use the Smithing Anvil to craft the Horn, and ready themselves for the battle of their lifetime.

How To Summon And Beat Velgar In RuneScape: Dragonwilds

With the Challenge Horn crafted, travel to Velgar's High (The Obelisk in the middle of Fractured Plains) and go through the big door to reach the top of the structure and find the pedestal to place the Horn. Now, select the first option to call Velgar and begin the battle.

Velgar has three different attacks players should be aware of:

  • Ground Slam/Spikes : The dragon slams the ground in front of it with its claw, crushing players who are not covered using Wind Shield and stunning them. Then, spikes sprout out of the ground and track the nearest players, striking twice and slowing them down. In each phase, after Velgar takes flight and returns, the Spikes grow in number.
  • Poison Breath : Velgar uses his poison breath to cause severe damage and poison the players. If they are buffed by the effects of Antipoison Potion and Anti-Poison Food, the damage will be minimal, and they will avoid the DoT effect.
  • Poison Meteors : Velgar takes flight and starts to summon poison meteors that rain from the sky. Dodging them and the puddles they create will minimize or negate the damage.

Once players defeat this beast, they should return to the Wise Old Man for their rewards: the Tome of The Dragonslayer, which grants 500 Exp for Ranged, Magic, and Attack, the Dragonblight Shield blueprint , which is crafted using the Anti-Dragon shield and the Dragon Visage (also rewarded from delivering Valgar's head to the Wise Old Man).

And there it is! Players have completed the end-game challenge of RuneScape: Dragonwilds. Still, there are dozens of secrets to explore, and soon, devs will bring even more content for this awesome survival game.
